title: Dakota Johnson's father Don, 69, WON'T watch Fifty Shades
text:
She became a household name after starring as Anastasia Steele in the very erotic Fifty Shades series.

And while he's fiercely proud of his daughter, Dakota Johnson, 30, it's perhaps fair enough that her father, Don Johnson won't be watching the movie.

The actor appeared on This Morning on Tuesday where he was asked if he had seen the film.

'There are things you don't want to see': Dakota Johnson's father Don, 69, revealed he WON'T be watching her in erotic Fifty Shades movies

The Miami Vice star appeared on This Morning on Tuesday and said: 'Hmmmm image control! There are certain images as a father you don’t really need to see'

He replied: 'Hmmmm image control! There are certain images as a father you don’t really need to see.'

He continued: 'I didn't have a clue she was interested [in acting]. She was always joyful on set and playing pranks on everybody. Little did I know, Miss Dakota was paying close inspection!'

Don, who shares Dakota with his ex, Melanie Griffith, was on the show to talk about his own latest movie offering. He is set to star in Knives Out, alongside Daniel Craig.

He continued: 'I didn't have a clue she was interested [in acting]. She was always joyful on set and playing pranks on everybody. Little did I know, Miss Dakota was paying close inspection!'

Romp fest: Dakota stars as Anastasia Steele in the Fifty Shades trilogy, based on the novels by English author E. L. James

Double trouble: She famously starred alongside Jamie Dornan in the films

He said: 'It was amazing, we have a thing in America where there are professional theatres called summer stock, we all used to do summer stock.

'Summer stock is in a tiny theatre, tiny green room, where you are stuck together, you hear all these stories.

'The same thing happened on the movie set, we all have these massive trailers, which house a family of six.'

He continued: ''You go in , get dressed, do makeup and go to set. After rehearsals we would find ourselves in this basement room sitting around between shots and telling stories.

'You can imagine, Christopher, Daniel and I – we’ve got a couple, it was exciting. I can’t tell any of them. I probably could but can’t remember the whole thing.'
